fields.toaster_info_text: Provide comprehensive HIV prevention options:- STI screening and treatment (syndromic and syphilis)- Condom promotion- Risk reduction counselling- PrEP with emphasis on adherence- Emphasize importance of follow-up ANC contact visits

fields.label: LMP Known?
fields.label_info_text: LMP = first day of Last Menstrual Period. If the exact date is unknown, but the period of the month is known, use day 5 for beginning of the month, day 15 for middle of the month and day 25 for end of the month. If completely unknown, check unknown and calculate GA from ultrasound (or SFH or abdominal palpation as a last resort).

fields.label: Ultrasound Done?
fields.label_info_text: An ultrasound is recommended for all women before 24 weeks gestation or even after if deemed necessary (e.g. to identify the number of fetuses, fetal presentation, or placenta location).

fields.toaster_info_text: An ultrasound is recommended for all women before 24 weeks gestation or even after if deemed necessary (e.g. to identify the number of fetuses, fetal presentation, or placenta location).

fields.label: Select preferred gestational age:
fields.label_info_text: If the difference between GA from LMP and early ultrasound is one week or less, then use GA from LMP.If the difference is more than 7 days, use the early ultrasound GA. If ultrasound was done late, use GA from LMP. Between late ultrasound and SFH or abdominalpalpation, use your best judgment to select GA.

fields.label: Daily caffeine intake
fields.label_text_info:
Pregnant women should not consume more than 300 mg of caffeine per day. Each of the followingrepresents 300 mg of caffeine.
- 2 cups (200ml) of filtered or commercially brewed coffee
- 2 small cups (50 ml)of espresso
- 3 cups (300ml) of instant coffee
- 48 pieces (squares) of chocolate.

v_required.err: Please select at least one medication

fields.toaster_info_text: Lowering daily caffeine intake during pregnancy is recommended to reduce the risk of pregnancy loss and low-birth-weight neonates.This includes any product, beverage or food containing caffeine (e.g. brewed coffee, tea, cola-type soft drinks, caffeinated energy drinks, chocolate, caffeine tablets). Caffeine-containing teas (black tea and green tea) and soft drinks (colas and iced tea) usually contain less than 50 mg per 250 mL serving

v_required.err: Please select if you use any tobacco products

fields.toaster_info_text: Healthcare providers should routinely offer advice and psycho-social interventions for tobacco cessation to all pregnant women who are either current tobacco users or recent tobacco quitters.
